DataElement.preferredName: Disease Status NCCN ALL Response Criterion Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the NCCN ALL disease response criteria for lymphomatous extramedullary disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criterion Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An alliance of 19 leading US cancer centers, an authoritative source of information to help patients and health professionals make informed decisions about cancer care. Through the collective expertise of its member institutions, the NCCN develops, updates, and disseminates a complete library of clinical practice guidelines. These guidelines are the standard for clinical policy in oncology._Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression._That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison._A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas._Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that an assessment was not performed.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Relapse

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Relapse
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Recurrence of mediastinal enlargement after achieving CR. For patients with a previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Relapse
Concepts.definition: Recurrence of mediastinal enlargement after achieving CR. For patients with a previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease No Response

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease No Response
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Failure to qualify for partial response or progressive disease. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease No Response
Concepts.definition: Failure to qualify for partial response or progressive disease. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Progressive Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Progressive Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than 25 percent increase in the SPD of patients with mediastinal enlargement. For patients with previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Progressive Disease
Concepts.definition: Greater than 25 percent increase in the SPD of patients with mediastinal enlargement. For patients with previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Partial Remission

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Partial Remission
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Greater than 50 percent disease in the sum of product of greatest perpendicular diameters (SPD) of the mediastinal enlargement for patients with a previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Partial Remission
Concepts.definition: Greater than 50 percent disease in the sum of product of greatest perpendicular diameters (SPD) of the mediastinal enlargement for patients with a previous positive PET scan, post-treatment PET must be positive in at least one previously involved site. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Complete Remission

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Complete Remission
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Complete resolution of lymphomatous enlargement by CT. For patients with a previous positive PET scan, a post-treatment residual mass of any size is considered a CR as long as it is PET negative. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

Concepts.longName: NCCN ALL Response Criteria for Lymphomatous Extramedullary Disease Complete Remission
Concepts.definition: Complete resolution of lymphomatous enlargement by CT. For patients with a previous positive PET scan, a post-treatment residual mass of any size is considered a CR as long as it is PET negative. (Adapted from NCCN Guidelines, Version 1.2020, February 20, 2020)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: National Comprehensive Cancer Network Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia Disease Response Criterion Lymphoma Extramedullary Disease or Disorder Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An alliance of 19 leading US cancer centers, an authoritative source of information to help patients and health professionals make informed decisions about cancer care. Through the collective expertise of its member institutions, the NCCN develops, updates, and disseminates a complete library of clinical practice guidelines. These guidelines are the standard for clinical policy in oncology.:Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.:That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.:A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.:Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: An alliance of 19 leading US cancer centers, an authoritative source of information to help patients and health professionals make informed decisions about cancer care. Through the collective expertise of its member institutions, the NCCN develops, updates, and disseminates a complete library of clinical practice guidelines. These guidelines are the standard for clinical policy in oncology.

Leukemia with an acute onset, characterized by the presence of lymphoblasts in the bone marrow and the peripheral blood. It includes the acute B lymphoblastic leukemia and acute T lymphoblastic leukemia.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.
That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.

A malignant (clonal) proliferation of B- lymphocytes or T- lymphocytes which involves the lymph nodes, bone marrow and/or extranodal sites. This category includes Non-Hodgkin lymphomas and Hodgkin lymphomas.
Outside of, or unrelated to, any medulla, especially the medulla oblongata.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
